oai_dc:dc.dc:title: X-ray absorption spectroscopic studies of the T '-type Gd1.85-xPrxCe0.15CuOy system
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GUPTA, S
SUBA, R
PADALIA, BD
PRAKASH, O
NAYAK, RM
GOPALAKRISHNAN, IK
YAKHMI, JV
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: electron
oxygen
superconductivity
nonstoichiometry
oxides
nd
sm
eu
gd
th
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: X-ray absorption near edge structure (XANES) studies on the T'-type Gd1.85-xPrxCe0.15CuOy; x = 0.00, 1.10, 1.35 and 1.85 are carried out. The Pr L-3-, Ce L-3- and Cu K-absorption edge regions in these compounds have been measured. Pr in the reduced superconducting (SC) samples is found to be in 3+ state, while in the oxygenated non-SC samples, signatures of both Pr3+ and Pr4+ are observed. Ce remains throughout in the mixed (3+, 4+) valent state. As the Pr concentration (x) in the reduced samples is increased, the unoccupied DOS, as reflected by intensity of the white line at the Cu K-edge, decreases. This is attributed to an increase in the electron density due to the creation of oxygen vacancies. (C) 1997
